intro: Orthandra indeniensis, commonly known as the Kauai orthandra, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively on the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often in the understory of native forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Orthandra indeniensis is considered critically endangered, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and preserve this unique botanical species.
